entries.name: Stirge spawner.
entries: Each round, at initiative 20 (losing all ties), the Stirge Hivemouth creates one new {@creature Stirge Bloodletter|GuildOfIcons} in its space.

entries.name: Collapsible.
entries: If the hivemouth takes 10 or more points of damage in one round, it collapses, preventing it from using the Stirge Spawner ability.

item.name: Perfect Mirror Metal Cube
entries: This cube is about an inch across. Each face has a distinct marking on it that can be pressed. The cube starts with 36 charges, and it regains 1d10 expended charges daily at dawn.
You can use an action to press one of the cube's faces. Each face has a different effect as shown in the Cube Faces table. If the cube has insufficient charges remaining, nothing happens.

Otherwise, a barrier of invisible force springs into existence, forming a cube 15 feet on a side. The barrier is centered on you, moves with you, and lasts for one minute, until you use an action to press the cube's sixth face, or the cube runs out of charges.
At the end of each of your turns, while the barrier is active, the cube loses charges based on the chosen face, as shown in the Cube Faces table.

You can change the barrier's effect by pressing a different face of the cube, resetting the duration. If your movement causes the barrier to come into contact with a solid object that can't pass through the cube, you can't move any closer to that object as long as the barrier remains.

entries.caption: Perfect Mirror Metal Cube Faces
rows: Gases, wind, and fog can't pass through the barrier.
Nonliving matter can't pass through the barrier. Walls, floors, and ceilings can pass through at your discretion.
Living matter can't pass through the barrier.
Spell effects can't pass through the barrier.
Nothing can pass through the barrier. Walls, floors, and ceilings can pass through at your discretion.

entries: The cube loses charges when the barrier is targeted by certain spells or comes into contact with certain spell or magic item effects, as shown in the table below.
You have advantage on saving throws to reduce or avoid cold, fire, and lightning damage while wearing this armor.

entries.name: Duration
entries: Two adventures

entries.name: Transmission
entries: Being affected by spells cast by somebody afflicted with the spellblight.

entries.name: Prevention
entries: Don't cast spells when you suffer the symptoms. Some protective runes or talismans can negate the energy.

entries.name: Detection
entries: Would show up as magical when Detect Magic is cast. Possibly showing every school of magic, or school of magic last cast by the user.
Identify malfunctions and shows a spell that is obviously not the spell you're affected by.

entries.name: Treatment
entries: Herbalists / Apothecaries / Potions

entries.name: Cure
entries: Lesser Restoration in Stage 1.
Greater Restoration in Stage 2.
Cures itself after two adventures.

entries.name: Stage 1
entries: Headaches and tinnitus.
Cannot cast spells at your highest spell slot level, but can use higher level spell slots to cast at a lower level.

entries.name: Stage 2 - After one adventure
entries: Vertigo - Disadvantage on Dexterity Checks and Saving Throws.

When you cast a levelled spell, roll a Constitution Saving Throw, DC of 10 + the level of the spell (cantrips are level 0). On a failure, the spell fizzles out, costing the spell slot and having no effect.

entries.name: Cured - After two adventures
entries: Vertigo - Disadvantage on Dexterity Checks and Saving Throws.

When you cast a levelled spell, roll a Constitution Saving Throw, DC of 10 + the level of the spell (cantrips are level 0). On a failure, the spell fizzles out, costing the spell slot and having no effect.

boon.name: Major Boon of Morion
entries: The first time you die, you instead gain 1 hitpoint and the boon is expended.

legendaryGroup.name: MirrorscaleBulette
lairActions: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the bulette takes one lair action to cause one of the following effects: The tremors of battle shake loose 5 ({@dice 2d4}) stirge minions from the cave roof, who join the battle.

items: Rocks shake loose from the ceiling. Creatures within 5 ft. of two points the bulette chooses must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage.
Rumbles shake the ground, churning it. The area extending 20 ft. from the bulette becomes difficult terrain.
A swirling storm of dust fills the room. Until the start of the next round, all creatures in the maelstrom are {@condition blinded}, and must spend 3 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves there.

lairActions: The bulette can't repeat an effect until they have all been used, and it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

legendaryGroup.name: Entropy
lairActions: When fighting inside the null zone, Entropy can invoke the ambient antimagic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Entropy can take one lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: Entropy targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. A crackling cord of negative energy tethers Entropy to the target. Whenever Entropy takes damage, the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, Entropy takes half the damage (rounded down), and the target takes the remaining damage. This tether lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round.
{@dice 1d4} Xeg-Yi and {@dice 1d4} Xag-Ya join the battle.
All creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage. Entropy regains 18 ({@dice 4d8}) hit points.

lairActions: Entropy can't repeat an effect until they have all been used, and it can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

legendaryGroup.name: MerrifrythWinnifreth
lairActions: When fighting inside the prison of creation, Merrifryth can invoke the potent creative magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), Merrifryth can take one lair action from the following, depending on what environment he is currently in.

items.name: 1. Graveyard
entries: Merrifryth creates an expansive graveyard in the prison of creation.

items.name: 1+ Army Of The Lost.
entries: The graves open and skeletons shamble from the dirt. Each {@creature skeleton} is a minion. There are 10 of them, and 10 more arrive each round.

items.name: 2 Stitch Flesh, Knit Bone.
entries: Merrifryth destroys 5 skeletons and raises in their place a {@creature Skeletal Juggernaut}.

entries.name: Conditions to proceed:
entries: Take out the skeletal juggernaut.

items.name: 2. Hurl Through Home
entries: Merrifryth recreates the crumbling spire of Wark.

items.name: 1 Great Heights Begat Great Falls.
entries: A sweeping wind threatens to push the party off the highest point on Wark and into the Glarus desert below. The desert is 2,000 ft. down. It will take 4 rounds to land.

items.name: 2 The Earth Shook And Groaned.
entries: The spire begins to crumble underfoot. All non-falling creatures must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall {@condition prone}.

items.name: 3 Rock Tore Asunder.
entries: The Wark spire shears, and half the spire falls into the desert below. It is a {@dc 20} dexterity saving throw to grab a safe ledge and climb up. Otherwise, a falling character takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage from the rocks as they start to fall.

items.name: 4 The Sands Offered Their Condolences.
entries: Those who have still been falling take 70 ({@damage 20d6}) bludgeoning damage. The desert sands are whipped up by the wind and blind everybody.

entries.name: Conditions to proceed:
entries: Cause Merrifryth to fall, or rescue all falling characters.

items.name: 3. The Great Masquerade
entries: All of a sudden you are bombarded with glittering light and raucous applause. Music plays. Gaudily-dressed people twist and turn on polished parquet, each covering their face with an animal mask. You realise Merrifryth is gone. One of you feels a dart puncture their skin.

entries.name: The people are real.
entries: They didn't exist before now, but they are real now.

entries.name: Find Merrifryth.
entries: He's using {@spell Disguise Self} to seem taller than he is. Detect magic can find him unless he has time to use Nystul's Mystic Aura to hide that, too. He's taken the form of a female wood elf wearing a panther mask. Merrifryth won't hide away, he enjoys the game. He will come over to the party and offer to help.

entries.name: Constantly moving.
entries: Even if they catch sight of somebody, the constant pirouetting and turning make it difficult to follow, like a cup game on the side of the road.

entries.name: Poison.
entries: The poison deals one character 18 ({@damage 4d8}) damage at the start of every round. Keep in initiative order for this. There is no save, only the antidote which Merrifryth has, or some other fix the players come up with.

entries.name: Conditions to proceed:
entries: Find Merrifryth or cure the poison.

items.name: 4. Flames Burn All Things
entries: A massive volcano rises from the middle of the ballroom floor and now the players are on the crumbling rim of an active volcano that bubbles below them.

items.name: Caldera
entries: The centre of the map is a searing caldera of liquid fire. Any creature falling in is subjected to 90 ({@damage 20d8}) fire damage.

items.name: 1. Tempest Of Stone
entries: All creatures on the ground {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or knocked {@condition prone}

items.name: 1. Lava Snakes
entries: 10 {@creature Fire Snake}s crawl out of the caldera and join initiative on Merrifryth's side. They are minions.

items.name: 2. Magma Plumes.
entries: Jet from the magma caldera. All creatures {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage.

items.name: 2. The Time To Flee Was Five Minutes Ago.
entries: The Caldera's magma level rises 10 feet. It is now close to overflowing.

items.name: 3. Eruption.
entries: The caldera's magma level bursts its banks, washing everybody on the ground in magma. There is no save. 45 ({@damage 10d8}) fire damage.

entries.name: Conditions to proceed:
entries: Activate Merrifryth's Mythic Trait.

items.name: [Special] The Sea of Stars
entries: A place of pure creation. It is the burning star-furnace at the heart of a cold, blue/green nebula.

items.name: 1. The Stars. By The Gods, The Stars.
entries: Merrifryth pulls a star from the night sky, crushes it in his hand, and whispers an incantation (counts as a spell, counterable). Merrifryth gains a ninth-level spell slot and can use it only to cast {@spell Prismatic Wall}.

items.name: 1. I Know That Hand, It Is My Own.
entries: Merrifryth renders every Merrifryth item inert. They lose all their magical abilities and become mundane objects.

items.name: 2. Breath of Creation.
entries: The winds of creation rush through Merrifryth, restoring 14 ({@dice 4d6}) hit points.

items.name: 2. Tempus Fugit.
entries: A red mote of creation coalesces over every PC. It forms the number 3. At the start of each turn after this, it counts down.

items.name: 3. Supernova.
entries: Merrifryth hurls a mote of creation at the party. It explodes in prismatic light, dealing 4 ({@dice 1d8}) each of necrotic, radiant, acid, thunder, lightning, cold, poison, fire, and force damage to all creatures.

items.name: 4. A Hole In Creation.
entries: Merrifryth calls forth the darkstar, a hungry, writhing mass of blackness that draws in the players and crushes them. {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) force damage.

items.name: 5. Tempus Fugit
entries: The motes of red light over each character's head ticks down to 0. Merrifryth casts {@spell Power Word Kill}, targeting every character.

entries.name: Conditions to proceed:
entries: Kill Merrifryth.

lairActions: Merrifryth takes lair actions in order, and only takes a new lair action if the last has resolved. If multiple lair actions are specified for the same turn, they all occur. If the conditions to proceed are met, the next Lair is immediately activated and its first turn actions are resolved.

condition.name: Death
entries: A creature with death has been doomed. The heroic tether that keeps their soul tied to the materium has been severed, and their time is limited.
Each time a creature gains one or more points of death, they must make a death saving throw. A creature takes a -1 penalty to death saving throws for each point of death they have.
Death saving throws do not reset for a creature while they have any points of death. A creature loses all points of death when they die.

If a creature with one or more points of death regains hit points, they may choose either to regain hit points or remove one point of death for every 10 hit points healed. If a creature loses their last point of death, their death saving throws reset unless they have 0 hit points.
If a creature fails 3 death saving throws before they lose all points of death, they die.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If Entropy fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Null Zone Immunity
entries: Entropy can cast spells in the null zone, and is immune to the null zone's effects.

trait.name: Necrotic Absorption
entries: Whenever Entropy is subjected to necrotic damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Weird (1/Day)
entries: Drawing on the deepest fears of its prey, Entropy creates illusory creatures in their minds, visible only to them. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes {@condition frightened} for the duration. The illusion calls on the creature's deepest fears, manifesting its worst nightmares as an implacable threat. At the end of each of the {@condition frightened} creature's turns, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

action.name: Power Word Pain [Recharge 6]
entries: Entropy speaks a word of power that causes waves of intense pain to assail one creature it can see within 60 ft. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, it is subject to crippling pain. Otherwise, the spell has no effect on it. A target is also unaffected if it is immune to being {@condition charmed}.

While the target is affected by crippling pain, any speed it has can be no higher than 10 feet. The target also has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws, other than Constitution saving throws. Finally, if the target tries to cast a spell, it must first succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, or the casting fails and the spell is wasted.
A target suffering this pain can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns. On a successful save, the pain ends.

action.name: Multi-attack
entries: Entropy makes three death blast attacks. Each attack must target a different creature.

action.name: Death Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 7} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@dice 2d6}) necrotic and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. A creature hit by this attack gains one point of {@condition death}.

action.name: Paralyzing Touch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

reaction.name: Equal and Opposite
entries: Trigger: When Entropy is hit by a spell that deals fire, lightning, force, or radiant damage. The origin of the damage must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or gain one point of {@condition death}.

legendary.name: Paralyzing Touch (2 actions)
entries: Entropy uses Paralyzing Touch.

legendary.name: Death Blast
entries: Entropy uses Death Blast.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eye Rays
entries: The beholder shoots three of the following magical eye rays at random (reroll duplicates), choosing one to three targets it can see within 120 feet of it:

items.name: 1. Confusion Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be subjected to the {@spell Confusion} spell for 1 minute (no {@status concentration}).

items.name: 2. Silence Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 3. Fear Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 4. Slowing Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target's speed is halved for 1 minute. In addition, the creature can't take reactions, and it can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

items.name: 5. Enervation Ray
entries: The targeted creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: 6. Telekinetic Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or the beholder moves it up to 30 feet in any direction. It is {@condition restrained} by the ray's telekinetic grip until the start of the beholder's next turn or until the beholder is {@condition incapacitated}. If the target is an object weighing 300 pounds or less that isn't being worn or carried, it is moved up to 30 feet in any direction. The beholder can also exert fine control on objects with this ray, such as manipulating a simple tool or opening a door or a container.

items.name: 7. Sleep Ray
entries: The targeted creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or fall asleep and remain {@condition unconscious} for 1 minute. The target awakens if it takes damage or another creature takes an action to wake it. This ray has no effect on constructs and undead.

items.name: 8. Puppet Ray
entries: The targeted creature begins a comic dance in place: shuffling, tapping its feet, and capering for 1 minute. Creatures that can't be {@condition charmed} are immune to this ray. A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance without leaving its space and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. While the target is affected by this spell, other creatures have advantage on attack rolls against it. As an action, a dancing creature makes a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw to regain control of itself. On a successful save, the spell ends.

items.name: 9. Disintegration Ray
entries: If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 10d8}) force damage. If this damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, its body becomes a pile of fine gray dust. If the target is a Large or smaller nonmagical object or creation of magical force, it is disintegrated without a saving throw. If the target is a Huge or larger object or creation of magical force, this ray disintegrates a 10-foot cube of it.

items.name: 10. Feeblemind Ray
entries: The targeted creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or their Charisma and Intelligence scores become 1.

monster.name: Merrifryth Winnifreth, Tempus Fugitive

trait.name: Time Is My Command
entries: Merrifryth does not roll initiative. His initiative score is 22.

trait.name: Channel Time
entries: If Merrifryth has at least one charge of Channelled Time, he may expend one charge to take a reaction even if he has already used his reaction since his last turn. If Merrifryth has at least three charges of Channelled Time, he may expend three charges to take an additional turn at the end of any creature's turn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Merrifryth has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Merrifryth fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lucky
entries: When Merrifryth rolls a 1 on the {@dice d20} for an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, he can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

trait.name: Sea of Stars
entries: When Merrifryth is reduced to 0 hit points, he instead regains all his hit points and immediately activates his Sea of Stars Lair Action. Additionally, he can now use his Mythic Actions as Legendary Actions.

action.name: Spellcasting
entries: For any spellcasting listed below, Merrifryth has a spell save DC of 19 and {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks.

action.name: Timestop (1/Day)
entries: Merrifryth casts {@spell Time Stop}. He gains 3 turns, which he uses to cast {@spell Mind Blank}, {@spell Mage Armor}, and {@spell Fire Shield} (in Cold Shield configuration).

action.name: Ravage of Time (1/Day)
entries: Merrifryth casts {@spell Abi-Dalzim's Horrid Wilting|XGE}.

action.name: Mass Suggestion (1/Day)
entries: Merrfryth casts {@spell Mass Suggestion} on every creature except Eao, and tries to convince the affected that Eao is actually Merrifryth and Merrifryth is Eao. It's all an illusion, we must attack Eao!

action.name: Dominate Person (1/Day)
entries: Merrifryth casts {@spell Dominate Person}.

action.name: Dispel Magic (3/Day)
entries: Merrifryth casts {@spell Dispel Magic}

action.name: Behold! The Elements! (Recharge 3+).
entries: Merrifryth casts {@spell Fireball}, {@spell Lightning Bolt}, {@spell Erupting Earth}, or {@spell Tidal Wave}.

action.name: Acid Arrow
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 90 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the start of its next turn. Miss: Half damage and no damage at the start of its next turn.

action.name: Shocking Grasp
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage and the target can't take reactions until the start of their next turn. The attack has advantage if the target is wearing metal armour.

reaction.name: I Do Not Miss
entries: When Merrifryth misses with an attack roll or when a creature succeeds on a Dexterity saving throw against one of Merrifryth's spells or effects, Merrifryth can cause the attack to hit or the target creature to fail their save.

reaction.name: Shield
entries: When an attack roll hits or magic missile is cast, Merrifryth can prevent all damage from magic missile and increase his AC by 5 until the start of his next turn.

reaction.name: Counterspell (3/Day)
entries: Merrifryth casts {@spell Counterspell}.

legendary.name: Seize Opportunity
entries: Merrifryth steals fragments of time from other people. One target creature must make a {@dc 15} Charisma Saving Throw. On a failed save, that creature cannot use their action on their next turn. Whether the target failed or succeeded on their save, Merrifryth gains one charge of Channelled Time.

mythicHeader: If Merrifryth's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Sea of Stars.

mythic.name: Create
entries: Merrifryth creates one object, such as a siege weapon, cauldron of boiling pitch, cloud of arrows, or any other item that fits within a 10 ft. cube. The object immediately targets one creature within 5 ft. using Merrifryth's spellcasting modifier. On a hit, the damage is 11 ({@dice 2d10}) of a type dependant on the item created. After making the attack, the object disintegrates into a constellation of stars.

mythic.name: Destroy (3 actions)
entries: Merrifryth points to one object that is being held or worn. Its bearer must make a {@dc 19} Charisma saving throw or the object is destroyed. The object is destroyed even if it is an artefact. The object disintegrates into feathers, butterflies, snakes, ash, or shards of glass.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: Take no damage on a successful Dexterity saving throw or half damage on a failed save.

trait.name: Wails from the Grave (4/Day)
entries: When Grounded hits with a sneak attack, a second target within 30 ft. takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Flame-Tongue Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage plus 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage plus 17 ({@dice 5d6}) sneak attack piercing damage.

action.name: Invisibility (1/Day)
entries: Can cast {@spell Invisibility}.

action.name: Fontaine's Growth (1/Day)
entries: Benefit from the Enlarge spell without {@status concentration}.

bonus.name: Steady Aim
entries: Gain advantage on the next attack, at the cost of all movement this turn.

bonus.name: Telekinetic Shove
entries: {@dc 14} strength save or creature is shoved towards you.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Half damage from one attack she can see.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Hannah is a 9th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). She has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Smite
entries: When Hannah hits with a melee weapon attack, she can spend a spell slot to deal {@damage 1d8} radiant damage per spell level.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hannah makes two Xifos attacks.

action.name: Xifos
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: War Hero
entries: Leitminster has advantage on Charisma checks and saving throws.

trait.name: Champion
entries: Leitminster scores a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

trait.name: Deft
entries: Leitminster adds {@damage 2d6} damage against creatures wearing medium or heavy armour.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Leitminster makes three Rapier attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Riposte (1/Day)
entries: Trigger: An attack misses you. Make a rapier attack and add 3 ({@dice 1d6}) to the damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Add +3 to your AC against a melee attack.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Fire Shield
entries: Whenever a creature within 5 ft hits the gnoll with a melee attack, the shield erupts with flame. The attacker takes 2d8 fire damage.

trait.name: Blink
entries: Roll a d20 at the end of each of your turns. On a roll of 11 or higher, you vanish and appear in the Ethereal Plane. At the start of your next turn, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of the space you vanished from.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Random Wand or Bite attacks.

action.name: Random Wand
entries: The Gnoll uses a random Wizard spell of 1st level or higher with a casting time of action that does not require {@status concentration}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Water Form
entries: The weirdlet can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. It can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Sonar
entries: The weirdlet can use its Tremorsense to detect other creatures in the same body of water it is in.

trait.name: Minion
entries: Any attack that hits or failed saving throw that damages this creature kills it. A successful save that deals half damage must deal the creature's hitpoint maximum to kill it.

action.name: Underwhelm
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 bludgeoning damage.

monster.name: Mirrorscale Bulette

trait.name: Standing Leap
entries: The bulette's long jump is up to 30 ft. and its high jump is up to 15 ft., with or without a running start.
Spiked carapace. Creatures who start their turn or enter within 5 ft. of the bulette take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. In mythic form, they also take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the bulette fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mirrormetal Flux (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If the bulette would be reduced to 0 hit points, its carapace cracks and reveals a shimmering, half-molten underlayer of mirrormetal. Liquid mirrormetal spurts in gouts from the wounds it has received.

It loses its damage resistance to piercing, bludgeoning, and slashing damage, and gains damage resistance to fire damage. Its current hit point total instead resets to 150 hit points, and it regains any expended uses of Legendary Resistance. Additionally, the bulette can now use the Launch attack, as well as the options in the "Mythic Actions" section for 1 hour. Award a party an additional 3,900 XP (7,800 XP total) for defeating the bulette after its Mirrormetal Flux activates.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15})

action.name: Deadly Leap
entries: If the bulette jumps at least 15 ft. as part of its movement, it can then use this action to land on its ft. in a space that contains one or more other creatures. Each of those creatures must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength or Dexterity saving throw (target's choice) or be knocked {@condition prone} and take 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) slashing damage. On a successful save, the creature takes only half the damage, isn't knocked {@condition prone}, and is pushed 5 ft. out of the bulette's space into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice. If no unoccupied space is within range, the creature instead falls {@condition prone} in the bulette's space.

action.name: Launch (Mythic)
entries: The bulette launches from beneath the earth in an eruption that shakes the ground. All creatures within 60 ft. of the eruption point must make a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, taking 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage and falling {@condition prone} on a failure or taking half as much damage and remaining standing on a success.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The Bulette makes a Bite attack.

legendary.name: Tunnel
entries: The bulette dives underground, moving up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Boulder Shell
entries: The bulette shrinks inside its carapace, increasing its AC to 22 until the end of the next creature's turn. While in the shell, it is {@condition incapacitated}.

mythicHeader: If the bulette's mythic trait is active, it can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using {Some Ability}.

mythic.name: Alloyed Resolve
entries: Liquid mirror metal fills and seals cracks in the bulette's carapace. It gains 9 ({@dice 2d8}) temporary hit points.

mythic.name: Burnish (3 actions)
entries: The bulette shoots a gout of liquid mirror metal from its carapace. The target must make a 15 Dexterity saving throw or take 36 ({@damage 8d8}) fire damage. If this damage reduces a creature to 0 hit points, they are {@condition petrified} as a mirror metal statue.

trait.name: Pike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The lost child can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the lost child has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Life Drain
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the creature finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

Luring laugh. The lost child laughs, drawing its prey closer. All creatures who cannot see the lost child must make a {@dc 11} Charisma saving throw or be {@condition charmed} by the lost child. A {@condition charmed} creature must use its movement to approach the source of the laughter. A creature who succeeds on the saving throw or who sees the lost child is no longer {@condition charmed} by its laughter and is immune to the effects for 24 hours.

monster.name: The Predator of Airedale Forest

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the predator fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the predator has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the predator scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the predator is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Displacement
entries: The predator projects a magical illusion that makes it appear to be standing near its actual location, causing attack rolls against it to have disadvantage. If it is hit by an attack, this trait is disrupted until the end of its next turn. This trait is also disrupted while the displacer beast is {@condition incapacitated} or has a speed of 0.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The predator makes two tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

Once per turn, if the predator moved at least 10 ft. straight toward the target on the same turn, the target takes an extra 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 12} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}. If the target is {@condition prone}, the predator can make another Bite attack against it as a bonus action.

legendaryHeader: The predator can take one legendary action per round at the end of another player's turn.

legendary.name: Hide
entries: The predator takes the Hide action.

monster.name: Zilx - Fontaine's Chosen

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 ft. of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunbaked King
entries: This Kobold is immune to Sunlight Sensitivity

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The kobold uses its Meld Through Stone and then makes three attacks with its Scimitar.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Meld Through Stone
entries: The kobold steps into the rock and appears at another location on the pillar within 120 ft. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendaryHeader: The kobold can take one villain action per round at the end of another player's turn. Each action is coded to a round and should be used then.

legendary.name: Round 1: Shape the Earth.
entries: The kobold forms the stone around one creature, creating horizontal walls of rock around them. That creature can make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a success, it can use its reaction to move up to its speed so that it is no longer enclosed by the wall.

legendary.name: Round 2: All Is Dust.
entries: The kobold pulls a cloud of dust from the pillar. Choose a point within 120 ft. A 20 ft. cloud of dust appears, obscuring the sunlight for creatures inside it, and acting like the {@spell Fog Cloud} spell without concentration.
The Fog dissipates at the end of round 3.

legendary.name: Round 3: Tremorshock.
entries: The kobold shakes the entire pillar with earth magic. All creatures on the pillar must succeed on a {@dc 13} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
Prone creatures fall.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

action.name: Thundersphere
entries: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from the jelly. Each creature in a 15-foot sphere originating from the jelly must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the jelly. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.
In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from the jelly, and the jelly emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jelly if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jelly are one size smaller than the original jelly.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Transmuter casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 13}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Cantlorian Transmuter Apprentice makes two unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage or more if the creature has used its Transmute ability again.

bonus.name: Transmute {@recharge 4}
entries: The Transmuter alters its physical form. It grows claws, fangs, spines, or horns. Its unarmed strikes deal 3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning, piercing, or slashing damage, as appropriate to the natural weapon it chooses. The natural weapon is magic and grants a +1 bonus to the attack and damage rolls. Each time it uses this feature after the first, the damage increases by 3 ({@dice 1d6}).

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The war mage casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}) At will: blade ward, message

trait.name: Tactical Wit
entries: The war mage adds their Intelligence modifier to initiative rolls.

trait.name: Durable Magic
entries: The war mage has +2 to AC and all saving throws while concentrating on a spell.

action.name: Sword Burst
entries: All creatures within 5ft. of the war mage must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) force damage.

action.name: Steel Wind Strike {@recharge 4}
entries: The war mage flourishes their weapon and vanishes to strike like the wind. Choose up to five creatures you can see within 30 ft. and make a melee spell attack ({@hit 7} to hit) against each target. On a hit, a target takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) force damage.
You can then teleport to an unoccupied space you can see within 5 feet of one of the targets you hit or missed.

reaction.name: Arcane Deflection
entries: When the war mage is hit by an attack or fails a saving throw, they can use their reaction to gain a +2 bonus to their AC against that attack or a +4 bonus to that saving throw. Up to three creatures of their choice that they can see within 60 ft. take 6 force damage.
When the war mage uses this feature, they can't cast spells other than cantrips until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The jelly can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The jelly can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Transparent
entries: Even when the jelly is in plain sight, it takes a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Perception) check to spot a jelly that has neither moved nor attacked. A creature that tries to enter the jelly's space while unaware of the jelly is surprised by the jelly.

trait.name: Silent Sphere
entries: No sound can be created within or pass through a 20 foot radius sphere centred on the jelly. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are {@condition deafened} while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

reaction.name: Split
entries: When a jelly that is Medium or larger is subjected to lightning or slashing damage, it splits into two new jelly if it has at least 10 hit points. Each new jelly has hit points equal to half the original jelly's, rounded down. New jelly are one size smaller than the original jelly.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Ansel fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Ansel's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Man's Best Friend
entries: If Ansel's Brass Defender is killed, when Ansel takes the Multiattack action, he can make an additional Megaton Fist attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Ansel makes two attacks, one with the Shock Gauntlet, and then one with the Megaton Fist. If either action has not recharged, Ansel substitutes it with a Punch attack.

action.name: Shock Gauntlet [Recharge 3-6]
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) lightning damage and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition paralyzed} until the end of Ansel's next turn.

action.name: Megaton Fist [Recharge 3-6]
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from Ansel must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from Ansel. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

action.name: Punch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dispel Magic (3/Day)
entries: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends.

bonus.name: Command Defender
entries: Ansel gives one command to his Brass Defender. The Brass Defender continues to carry out that command until another is issued.

reaction.name: Hellish Rebuke (1/Day)
entries: When Ansel is damaged by a creature within 60 ft. that he can see, he points his finger, and the creature that damaged him is momentarily surrounded by hellish flames. The creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. It takes (16) {@damage 3d10} fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Villain Actions
entries: If Ansel is used as a villain, he can use his villain actions. One villain action can be taken per round, and must be taken after another creature has ended their turn. Each villain action can be taken only once per short rest, unless otherwise specified.

entries.name: Conjure Guardian.
entries: Ansel pulls his Brass Defender from a pocket dimension to an unoccupied space within 30ft. The Brass Defender acts immediately.

entries.name: The Modern Icarus.
entries: Wings of brass protrude from the mantel's back. Until the end of Ansel's next turn, Ansel has a fly speed equal to 60 ft.

entries.name: Arcane Artillery (2 uses).
entries: A sheet of iron slides back on one of Ansel's shoulders, revealing a bank of 8 crystals. Each crystal launches into the air as a Magic Missile, homing in on and striking a target of Ansel's choice within 120 ft., dealing 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) force damage. Unlike Magic Missile, these missiles do not need line of sight.

trait.name: Vigilant
entries: The defender can't be surprised.

action.name: Force-Empowered Rend
entries: {@atk mw} +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target you can see. {@h}{@damage 1d8 + 4} force damage.

action.name: Repair (3/Day)
entries: The magical mechanisms inside the defender restore {@dice 2d8 + 4} hit points to itself or to one construct or object within 5 feet of it.

reaction.name: Deflect Attack
entries: The defender imposes disadvantage on the attack roll of one creature it can see that is within 5 feet of it, provided the attack roll is against a creature other than the defender.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork beetle queen is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork beetle queen has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The queen regains 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The queen makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d8 + 2}) piercing damage and the target must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or take an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) poison damage.

bonus.name: Spawn
entries: The queen creates a new Scuttlebug. It appears in an unoccupied square within 5ft. of the queen.

monster.name: Scuttlebug
languages: understands Common and telepathy 100 ft. (creator only)

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The clockwork beetle is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The clockwork beetle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage, or one-half poison damage with a successful {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: When the shadow takes fire damage it instead takes no damage and heals by the amount of damage that would be dealt.

trait.name: Chromatic Stealth
entries: While in dim light, red light, or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +7.

trait.name: Colour Weakness
entries: While in sunlight or blue light, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

trait.name: Magical Essence
entries: {@spell Dispel magic} will instantly destroy a Shadow.

action.name: Wisdom Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) fire damage, and the target's Wisdom score is reduced by {@dice 1d4 + 1}. The target dies if this reduces its Wisdom to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny construct. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 0 ft., up to 4 creatures in the swarm's space. {@h}17 ({@damage 5d6}) piercing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage.

monster.name: Mirrormetal Golem

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the minion takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the minion takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum, otherwise they take no damage.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 piercing damage.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The gnoll makes three Biting Blade attacks.

action.name: Biting Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage and the target starts bleeding for 1 minute. While bleeding, the target takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage at the start of each of its turns.

A bleeding creature may make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. The effect is ended if the creature receives at least 8 hit points of healing in one turn.

bonus.name: Call To Violence
entries: The gnoll barks a guttural order to another gnoll within 30 ft. The target can use its reaction to make a single melee weapon attack.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Combat Archery
entries: The Gnoll does not make its Shortbow attacks at disadvantage while it is within the reach of an enemy.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Shortbow attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the target is within 10 ft.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Icon of Blood
entries: Gnoll within 20 ft. of the Icon of Blood can use their Multiattack actions even if they are not Bloodied.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Dark Impulse attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dark Impulse
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Inspire Violence (1/Long Rest)
entries: The Gnoll briefly embodies the spirit of Yeenoghu through their Icon of Blood. All Gnoll within 20 ft. of the Icon can immediately make one Bite attack against one target within range.

bonus.name: Plant / Retrieve Icon
entries: The Gnoll can plant the Icon of Blood in the ground. While planted, the Icon of Blood can be targeted by enemy attacks. It has AC 13 and 20 hit points.
The Gnoll can retrieve a planted icon if they are within 5ft. of it.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Shield Interdiction
entries: When an enemy within 5 ft. of the Gnoll attacks an ally, the Gnoll interposes their shield to deflect the blow. The ally's AC becomes 19 until the end of the turn.

monster.name: Mirror Metal Golem (Guardian Configuration)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Reflection
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the golem passes a saving throw for a spell with a single target or a line area of effect, the spell is reflected back to the attacker.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the golem fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Soporific Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales sleeping gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, falling asleep on a failed save.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: The golem makes one Slam attack.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The golem makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

monster.name: Mirror Metal Golem (War Configuration)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Reflection
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the golem passes a saving throw for a spell with a single target or a line area of effect, the spell is reflected back to the attacker.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes three Crystalline Sword attacks.

action.name: Crystalline Sword (Lunge)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., all targets in a line originating from the Golem. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Crystalline Sword (Sweep)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., all targets in reach. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ice Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales freezing gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) cold damage and being {@condition restrained} by ice on a failed save, or half as much damage and unrestrained on a success. A creature {@condition restrained} by ice can use an action to break free from the ice. Dealing 10 points of damage to a {@condition restrained} creature (or half that if it is fire damage) frees them.

monster.name: Mirror Metal Golem (Scout Configuration)

immune.note: from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Reflection
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects. If the golem passes a saving throw for a spell with a single target or a line area of effect, the spell is reflected back to the attacker.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two Bodyslam attacks.

action.name: Bodyslam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the golem has moved at least 10ft. this turn, the damage increases to 25 ({@dice 4d8 + 7})

action.name: Invigorating Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales invigorating gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature the golem chooses in the area are affected as if by the {@spell Haste} spell.

trait.name: Berserker Rage
entries: When the Gnoll has fewer than half its hit points remaining, it can use its Multiattack action.

trait.name: Draw A Bead
entries: If the Gnoll does not move this turn, they gain advantage on attack rolls with their Longbow

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodied only)
entries: The Gnoll makes two Longbow attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4 - 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage plus 5 ({@damage 2d4}) poison damage.

action.name: Debilitating Serum (2/Long Rest)
entries: The Gnoll coats an arrow with a rare poison. Make a Longbow attack against a target. If the attack hits, the target must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or be Paralysed for one minute. The target may repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success.

reaction.name: Nightpowder (1/Long Rest)
entries: As a reaction when an attack hits the Gnoll, the Gnoll disappears in a puff of black smoke, laced with stars. It reappears in an unoccupied position of its choice within 20 ft and the attack misses.

trait.name: Cold Absorption
entries: When the shadow takes cold damage it instead takes no damage and heals by the amount of damage that would be dealt.

trait.name: Chromatic Stealth
entries: While in dim light, blue light, or darkness, the shadow can take the Hide action as a bonus action. Its stealth bonus is also improved to +7.

trait.name: Colour Weakness
entries: While in sunlight or red light, the shadow has disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

trait.name: Magical Essence
entries: {@spell Dispel magic} will instantly destroy a Shadow.

action.name: Intelligence Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 3d6 + 3}) fire damage, and the target's Intelligence score is reduced by {@dice 1d4 + 1}. The target dies if this reduces its Intelligence to 0. Otherwise, the reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest.
If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a new shadow rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

trait.name: Minion
entries: If the minion takes damage from an attack or as the result of a failed saving throw, their hit points are reduced to 0. If the minion takes damage from another effect, they die if the damage equals or exceeds their hit point maximum, otherwise they take no damage.

trait.name: Bloodsucker
entries: When a creature loses hit points due to blood loss caused by a Stirge, its hit point maximum is reduced by half the total hit point loss this turn. A creature drained in this way recovers their hit point maximum after a long rest.

trait.name: Malevolent Grasp
entries: While the Stirge is attached to a creature, attacks against it are at disadvantage.

action.name: Blood Drain (Group Attack)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, one creature. {@h}1 piercing damage, and the Stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the Stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the Stirge's turns, the target loses 1 hit point due to blood loss. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the Stirge.

trait.name: Bloodsucker
entries: When a creature loses hit points due to blood loss caused by a Stirge, its hit point maximum is reduced by half the hit points lost. A creature drained in this way recovers their hit point maximum after a long rest.

trait.name: Malevolent Grasp
entries: While the Stirge is attached to a creature, attacks against it are at disadvantage.

action.name: Blood Drain
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, one creature. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage, and the Stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the Stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the Stirge's turns, the target loses 5 hit points due to blood loss. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the Stirge.

trait.name: Bloodsucker
entries: When a creature loses hit points due to blood loss caused by a Stirge, its hit point maximum is reduced by half the hit points lost. A creature drained in this way recovers their hit point maximum after a long rest.

trait.name: Malevolent Grasp
entries: While the Stirge is attached to a creature, attacks against it are at disadvantage.

action.name: Blood Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the Stirge attaches to the target. While attached, the Stirge doesn't attack. Instead, at the start of each of the Stirge's turns, the target loses 10 hit points due to blood loss. A creature, including the target, can use its action to detach the Stirge.

trait.name: Bloodsucker
entries: When a creature loses hit points due to blood loss caused by a Stirge, its hit point maximum is reduced by half the hit points lost. A creature drained in this way recovers their hit point maximum after a long rest.

trait.name: Lacerator
entries: When the Stirge deals damage to a creature using its Razorwing attack, the target loses two hit points due to blood loss for each Stirge attached to the creature.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Stirge makes three razorwing attacks.

action.name: Razorwing
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Polymer Armour
entries: The starborn has advantage on saving throws to reduce or avoid cold, fire, and lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The starborn makes two Pulse Musket attacks.

action.name: Storm Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) thunder damage. Another enemy within 10 ft. takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Pulse Musket
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d6 + 2}) radiant damage.

bonus.name: Warpstep
entries: The starborn fades through a cloak of stars, appearing in an unoccupied space it can see within 20 ft.

trait.name: Polymer Armour
entries: The starborn has advantage on saving throws to reduce or avoid cold, fire, and lightning damage.

action.name: Storm Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) thunder damage. Another enemy within 10 ft. takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Pulse Cannon
entries: The starborn fires a spread shot of superheated light in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Warpstep
entries: The starborn fades through a cloak of stars, appearing in an unoccupied space it can see within 20 ft.

trait.name: Polymer Armour
entries: The starborn has advantage on saving throws to reduce or avoid cold, fire, and lightning damage.

action.name: Pulse Arquebus
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 60/300 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d8 + 3}) radiant damage.

action.name: Overwatch
entries: The starborn readies a shot for the right moment. When a creature they can see makes an attack or moves, they can use their reaction to make a Pulse Arquebus attack with advantage.

bonus.name: Warpstep
entries: The starborn fades through a cloak of stars, appearing in an unoccupied space it can see within 20 ft.

reaction.name: Overwatch Shot
entries: The starborn makes a Pulse Arquebus attack with advantage. The starborn can only use this if they used the Overwatch action on their last turn.

trait.name: Polymer Armour
entries: The starborn has advantage on saving throws to reduce or avoid cold, fire, and lightning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The starborn makes two Storm Gauntlet attacks.

action.name: Storm Gauntlet
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) thunder damage. Another enemy within 10 ft. takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

bonus.name: Warpstep
entries: The starborn fades through a cloak of stars, appearing in an unoccupied space it can see within 20 ft.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Alana casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}) At will: detect magic, message

trait.name: Discern Lie
entries: The drow discerns when a creature in earshot speaks a lie in a language the drow knows.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Alana has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Alana to sleep.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the Alana has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Alana makes three attacks with her Poison-coated Short Sword.
Poison-coated Short Sword. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage.

bonus.name: Spectral Dagger (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The drow conjures a floating, spectral dagger within 60 feet of itself. The drow can make a melee spell attack ({@hit 10} to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger. On a hit, the target takes 9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) force damage.
The dagger lasts for 1 minute. As a bonus action on later turns, the drow can move the dagger up to 20 feet and repeat the attack against one creature within 5 feet of the dagger.
